page.title: 14Tourism in Beaconsfield
page.content: By using several questionnaires we discovered that picturesque Old Beaconsfield attracts tourists from all over the world. Its architecture is varied with timber-framed buildings, old cottages, uneven roof lines and the beautiful parish church of St.Mary's, all very attractive features of England's rural charm. To cater for tourists and a large regional market, many antique shops, pubs., restaurants and two art galleries have sprung up. Other attractions include the workplace of famous novelist, G.K.Chesterton and politician Edmund Burke. The New Town, home of many London commuters, developed around the railway (built in 1906). Its one major tourist attraction is the model village called Bekonscot(1929). The busiest time of the year is the summer when the weather is a little better for sightseeing.
